item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elizabeth West
item.description: "There are two sides to a coin, but only one is right." -- Elizabeth West

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "When a person doesnâ€™t have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity. A person can almost be defined by his or her attitude toward gratitude." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by elie wiesel
item.description: "For the dead and the living, we must bear witness." -- elie wiesel

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elie Wiesel
Elizabeth add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "[Moishe] explained to me, with great emphasis, that every question possessed a power that was lost in the answer.... And why do you pray, Moishe?' I asked him. I pray to the God within me for the strength to ask Him the real questions." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Joseph Stalin
item.description: "Those who vote decide nothing. Those who count the vote decide everything." -- Joseph Stalin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Joseph Stalin
item.description: "A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic." -- Joseph Stalin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Upton Sinclair
item.description: "It is difficult to get a man to understand something, when his salary depends on his not understanding it." -- Upton Sinclair

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "You're going to come across people in your life who will say all the right words at all the right times. But in the end, it's always their actions you should judge them by. It's actions, not words, that matter." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "I am nothing special, of this I am sure. I am a common man with common thoughts and I've led a common life. There are no monuments dedicated to me and my name will soon be forgotten, but I've loved another with all my heart and soul, and to me, this has always been enough.." -- Nicholas Sparks
